a process in which new neurons (= nerve cells that carry information between the brain and other parts of the body) are formed in the brain: It is one of the few brain regions where neurogenesis occurs. The growth of new brain cells – a process called neurogenesis – is involved in new memory formation.
More examplesFewer examplesRecent discoveries show that adults sprout new brain cells throughout life, a process called neurogenesis.After that, neurogenesis occurs as precursor cells mature to become neurons.By the time the clinical expression of schizophrenia is apparent, neurogenesis and development is essentially complete.
